dir.name: Dataflow/Constraints

fit.p: Dataflow/Constraints contains a set of constraint classes. These classes can be used to maintain constrained relationships such that when one variable changes, the other inter-dependent variables can be updated accordingly. For example, with the DistanceConstraint, two points are constrained to be a fixed distance apart. If one point moves to a new location, the other point must be moved in order to maintain that constraint. Some of the simpler constraints are solved using direct methods, while more complex constraints are solved using interative methods.

dir.use:
The classes in this directory are useful when there is a constrained relationship between data values. The specific constraints we have implemented are geometric in nature, arrising from our primary application of these classes: 3D widget controls.
To date, these constraints have only been used within the widget classes, but they are general enough that they can directly be used elsewhere.
</use
